text: The President's House was built in 1953 and served as the primary residence for every University of Florida president until 2006, when President Bernie Machen chose to relocate to a private residence off campus. It was replaced in 2015 with the Dasburg House which is the current residence of the President of UF. It was re-named Earl and Christy Powell University House.https://www.usgbc.org/projects/dasburg-house-uf-presidents-house https://www.gainesville.com/article/LK/20150731/News/604158947/GS Gainesville Sun reference The facility now is open to UF organizations and groups that want to entertain, meet or hold a retreat there.Campus Map info ==References== ==External links== *https://president.ufl.edu/office/house/ Official website] *Gainesville Sun article about President's House Category:Houses completed in 1953 Category:Buildings at the University of Florida Category:Houses in Alachua County, Florida Category:1953 establishments in Florida Category:University and college buildings completed in 1953
title: President's House (University of Florida)
